techmeme.title: Ex-Facebook director Katie Harbath says Mark Zuckerberg's team uses elections to take stock of "where society is, to readjust how they're approaching content" (Bloomberg)
Global venture funding rose 3% YoY to ~$314B in 2024; venture funding to US companies totaled $178B, out of which $90B was invested in Bay Area startups (Gené Teare/Crunchbase News)
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says that MediaTek will be able to sell the CPU chip that the two companies unveiled for Project DIGITS, Nvidia's first desktop computer (Stephen Nellis/Reuters)
Atlanta-based HR and payroll software startup OnPay raised a $63M Series B led by Carrick Capital Partners, taking its total raised to $165M+ in equity and debt (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
The US NLRB says Google is a "joint employer" of ~50 Accenture Flex workers who joined the Alphabet Workers Union in 2023 and must bargain with their union (Daniel Wiessner/Reuters)
